channel.title: Eagle on tgauweiler
channel.description: Recent content in Eagle on tgauweiler

item.title: ESP01 programming board
item.description: Introduction I did buy a ESP8266 board in the variant ESP-01. Mostly because it was so cheap. Then i noticed that programming it wasn’t working as intended, because the chip needs around 250mW 3.3V to get running and the usb to serial converter isnt providing that much docu. So I build the given circuit on a breadboard to provide enough power. Design own platine with Eagle But since that was pretty ugly I decided to build my own platine for it with eagle.

item.title: Toner transfer method for PCBs
item.description: Introduction So for my esp project i wanted to create my own PCB. Because ordering only one PCB is pretty expensive i decided to make my own with the toner transfer method described here. I dismantled my cheap Genie Laminator (TODO ADD PICTURES!) and found out that it uses two temperature resistors to control the heating of the rollers. A quick search on ebay turned up two replacements parts for 180°C and 200°C.
